channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Intensity-free Integral-based Learning of Marked Temporal Point Processes
item.description: In the marked temporal point processes (MTPP), a core problem is to parameterize the conditional joint PDF (probability distribution function) $p^*(m, t)$ for inter-event time $t$ and mark $m$, conditioned on the history.

item.title: CT Reconstruction from Few Planar X-rays with Application towards Low-resource Radiotherapy
item.description: In this work, we propose a method to generate CT volumes from few (<5) planar X-ray observations using a prior data distribution, and perform the first evaluation of such a reconstruction algorithm for a clinical application: radiotherapy planning.

item.title: Learning Referring Video Object Segmentation from Weak Annotation
item.description: To relieve the burden of data annotation while maintaining sufficient supervision for segmentation, we propose a new annotation scheme, in which we label the frame where the object first appears with a mask and use bounding boxes for the subsequent frames.

item.title: Adapting to Change: Robust Counterfactual Explanations in Dynamic Data Landscapes
item.description: The GAEs minimise the reconstruction error between the original graph and its learned representation during training.

item.title: Universal Defensive Underpainting Patch: Making Your Text Invisible to Optical Character Recognition
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel and effective defense mechanism termed the Universal Defensive Underpainting Patch (UDUP) that modifies the underpainting of text images instead of the characters.

item.title: MM-Vet: Evaluating Large Multimodal Models for Integrated Capabilities
item.description: Problems include: (1) How to systematically structure and evaluate the complicated multimodal tasks; (2) How to design evaluation metrics that work well across question and answer types; and (3) How to give model insights beyond a simple performance ranking.

item.title: Convolutions Die Hard: Open-Vocabulary Segmentation with Single Frozen Convolutional CLIP
item.description: The proposed FC-CLIP, benefits from the following observations: the frozen CLIP backbone maintains the ability of open-vocabulary classification and can also serve as a strong mask generator, and the convolutional CLIP generalizes well to a larger input resolution than the one used during contrastive image-text pretraining.

item.title: T-UNet: Triplet UNet for Change Detection in High-Resolution Remote Sensing Images
item.description: Siamese structure focuses on extracting object features at different times but lacks attention to change information, which leads to false alarms and missed detections.

item.title: Sinhala-English Parallel Word Dictionary Dataset
item.description: However, in the cases where one of the considered language pairs is a low-resource language, the existing top-down parallel data such as corpora are lacking in both tally and quality due to the dearth of human annotation.

item.title: Efficient Labelling of Affective Video Datasets via Few-Shot & Multi-Task Contrastive Learning
item.description: Whilst deep learning techniques have achieved excellent emotion prediction, they still require large amounts of labelled training data, which are (a) onerous and tedious to compile, and (b) prone to errors and biases.

item.title: Motion-robust free-running cardiovascular MRI
item.description: For validation, CORe is first compared to traditional compressed sensing (CS), robust regression (RR), and another outlier rejection method using two simulation studies.

item.title: Painterly Image Harmonization using Diffusion Model
item.description: Painterly image harmonization aims to insert photographic objects into paintings and obtain artistically coherent composite images.

item.title: Towards Personalized Prompt-Model Retrieval for Generative Recommendation
item.description: With recent advances in Generative AI such as GPT and Diffusion models, a new form of recommendation task is yet to be explored where items are to be created by generative models with personalized prompts.

item.title: Multi-interactive Feature Learning and a Full-time Multi-modality Benchmark for Image Fusion and Segmentation
item.description: Multi-modality image fusion and segmentation play a vital role in autonomous driving and robotic operation.

item.title: Learning to Paraphrase Sentences to Different Complexity Levels
item.description: We compare these datasets, one labeled by a weak classifier and the other by a rule-based approach, with a single supervised dataset.

item.title: Emo-DNA: Emotion Decoupling and Alignment Learning for Cross-Corpus Speech Emotion Recognition
item.description: On one hand, our contrastive emotion decoupling achieves decoupling learning via a contrastive decoupling loss to strengthen the separability of emotion-relevant features from corpus-specific ones.

item.title: Finding Tori: Self-supervised Learning for Analyzing Korean Folk Song
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a computational analysis of the field recording dataset of approximately 700 hours of Korean folk songs, which were recorded around 1980-90s.

item.title: A stochastic optimization approach to train non-linear neural networks with regularization of higher-order total variation
item.description: While highly expressive parametric models including deep neural networks have an advantage to model complicated concepts, training such highly non-linear models is known to yield a high risk of notorious overfitting.

item.title: Deep Semantic Model Fusion for Ancient Agricultural Terrace Detection
item.description: Discovering ancient agricultural terraces in desert regions is important for the monitoring of long-term climate changes on the Earth's surface.

item.title: Explaining Relation Classification Models with Semantic Extents
item.description: We introduce semantic extents, a concept to analyze decision patterns for the relation classification task.

item.title: A State-Space Perspective on Modelling and Inference for Online Skill Rating
item.description: This paper offers a comprehensive review of the main methodologies used for skill rating in competitive sports.

item.title: Likelihood-ratio-based confidence intervals for neural networks
item.description: This paper introduces a first implementation of a novel likelihood-ratio-based approach for constructing confidence intervals for neural networks.

item.title: Balanced Classification: A Unified Framework for Long-Tailed Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we contend that the learning bias originates from two factors: 1) the unequal competition arising from the imbalanced distribution of foreground categories, and 2) the lack of sample diversity in tail categories.

item.title: Towards Generalist Foundation Model for Radiology
item.description: Our contribution can be concluded as follows: (i), we construct a large-scale Medical Multi-modal Dataset, MedMD, consisting of 16M 2D and 3D medical scans.

item.title: AutoML4ETC: Automated Neural Architecture Search for Real-World Encrypted Traffic Classification
item.description: However, in production use, it has been shown that a DL classifier's performance inevitably decays over time.

item.title: Statistical Estimation Under Distribution Shift: Wasserstein Perturbations and Minimax Theory
item.description: Under a squared loss for mean estimation and prediction error in linear regression, we find the exact minimax risk, a least favorable perturbation, and show that the sample mean and least squares estimators are respectively optimal.

item.title: Neural Collapse Terminus: A Unified Solution for Class Incremental Learning and Its Variants
item.description: Beyond the normal case, long-tail class incremental learning and few-shot class incremental learning are also proposed to consider the data imbalance and data scarcity, respectively, which are common in real-world implementations and further exacerbate the well-known problem of catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: Disentangling Multi-view Representations Beyond Inductive Bias
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel multi-view representation disentangling method that aims to go beyond inductive biases, ensuring both interpretability and generalizability of the resulting representations.

item.title: Multi-scale Cross-restoration Framework for Electrocardiogram Anomaly Detection
item.description: To address this challenge, this paper introduces a novel multi-scale cross-restoration framework for ECG anomaly detection and localization that considers both local and global ECG characteristics.

item.title: Balanced Destruction-Reconstruction Dynamics for Memory-replay Class Incremental Learning
item.description: By dynamically manipulating the gradient during training based on these factors, BDR can effectively alleviate knowledge destruction and improve knowledge reconstruction.

item.title: PoissonNet: Resolution-Agnostic 3D Shape Reconstruction using Fourier Neural Operators
item.description: Furthermore, we demonstrate that the Poisson surface reconstruction problem is well-posed in the limit case by showing a universal approximation theorem for the solution operator of the Poisson equation with distributional data utilizing the Fourier Neuronal Operator, which provides a theoretical foundation for our numerical results.

item.title: NuInsSeg: A Fully Annotated Dataset for Nuclei Instance Segmentation in H&E-Stained Histological Images
item.description: In this work, we release one of the biggest fully manually annotated datasets of nuclei in Hematoxylin and Eosin (H&E)-stained histological images, called NuInsSeg.

item.title: Characterization of differences in immune responses during bolus and continuous infusion endotoxin challenges using mathematical modeling
item.description: Cytokine measurements reveal that the bolus injection leads to significantly higher peaks for IL-8, while IL-10 reaches significantly higher peaks during continuous administration.

item.title: Path Shadowing Monte-Carlo
item.description: We introduce a Path Shadowing Monte-Carlo method, which provides prediction of future paths, given any generative model.

item.title: Point2Mask: Point-supervised Panoptic Segmentation via Optimal Transport
item.description: Weakly-supervised image segmentation has recently attracted increasing research attentions, aiming to avoid the expensive pixel-wise labeling.

item.title: DMDC: Dynamic-mask-based dual camera design for snapshot Hyperspectral Imaging
item.description: First, the system learns the spatial feature distribution of the scene based on the RGB images, then instructs the SLM to encode each scene, and finally sends both RGB and CASSI images to the network for reconstruction.

item.title: Enhancing Visibility in Nighttime Haze Images Using Guided APSF and Gradient Adaptive Convolution
item.description: In this paper, we enhance the visibility from a single nighttime haze image by suppressing glow and enhancing low-light regions.

item.title: Unsupervised Representation Learning for Time Series: A Review
item.description: However, there is a lack of systematic analysis of unsupervised representation learning approaches for time series.

item.title: Adversarial Training of Denoising Diffusion Model Using Dual Discriminators for High-Fidelity Multi-Speaker TTS
item.description: The evaluation results show that the proposed model outperforms recent state-of-the-art models such as FastSpeech2 and DiffGAN-TTS in various metrics.

item.title: Incorporating Recklessness to Collaborative Filtering based Recommender Systems
item.description: Recommender systems that include some reliability measure of their predictions tend to be more conservative in forecasting, due to their constraint to preserve reliability.

item.title: Causal thinking for decision making on Electronic Health Records: why and how
item.description: We illustrate the various choices in studying the effect of albumin on sepsis mortality in the Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care database (MIMIC-IV).

item.title: URET: Universal Robustness Evaluation Toolkit (for Evasion)
item.description: In this work, we propose a new framework to enable the generation of adversarial inputs irrespective of the input type and task domain.

item.title: VisAlign: Dataset for Measuring the Degree of Alignment between AI and Humans in Visual Perception
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the models' visual perception alignment with humans, further referred to as AI-human visual alignment.

item.title: UniG-Encoder: A Universal Feature Encoder for Graph and Hypergraph Node Classification
item.description: In this work, a universal feature encoder for both graph and hypergraph representation learning is designed, called UniG-Encoder.

item.title: Feature Noise Boosts DNN Generalization under Label Noise
item.description: In this study, we introduce and theoretically demonstrate a simple feature noise method, which directly adds noise to the features of training data, can enhance the generalization of DNNs under label noise.

item.title: Unsupervised Multiplex Graph Learning with Complementary and Consistent Information
item.description: Unsupervised multiplex graph learning (UMGL) has been shown to achieve significant effectiveness for different downstream tasks by exploring both complementary information and consistent information among multiple graphs.

item.title: Diffusion Models for Counterfactual Generation and Anomaly Detection in Brain Images
item.description: Segmentation masks of pathological areas are useful in many medical applications, such as brain tumour and stroke management.

item.title: RegionBLIP: A Unified Multi-modal Pre-training Framework for Holistic and Regional Comprehension
item.description: To this end, we propose to extract features corresponding to regional objects as soft prompts for LLM, which provides a straightforward and scalable approach and eliminates the need for LLM fine-tuning.

item.title: MAP: A Model-agnostic Pretraining Framework for Click-through Rate Prediction
item.description: The large capacity of neural models helps digest such massive amounts of data under the supervised learning paradigm, yet they fail to utilize the substantial data to its full potential, since the 1-bit click signal is not sufficient to guide the model to learn capable representations of features and instances.

item.title: ClassEval: A Manually-Crafted Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs on Class-level Code Generation
item.description: Third, we find that generating the entire class all at once (i. e. holistic generation strategy) is the best generation strategy only for GPT-4 and GPT-3. 5, while method-by-method generation (i. e. incremental and compositional) is better strategies for the other models with limited ability of understanding long instructions and utilizing the middle information.
